newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ dollar closes firmer, bid tone seen prevailing.
newsitem.headline: NZ dollar closes firmer, bid tone seen prevailing.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar closed a touch firmer on Monday and dealers said it would carry a bid tone into overnight trade.
The Kiwi ended at US$0.6993/00 and at 66.72 on its Trade-Weighted Index, up slightly from its 0.6988/95 and 66.68 open.
"It's month's end so we saw a bit of selling coming through from the corporates, but there was also good interest to buy it down around the 0.6990 area," said one dealer.
"It's finished up with a bit more of a positive tone."

Bankers Trust dealer Phil Lindberg said it had been an uneventful day for the Kiwi, with the quarter's end coinciding with Japan's half-year end, but he expected buying interest in the Kiwi to intensify as the week progressed.

"Expect to see some more action as we go forward in the week. I think there's probably still interest out of Japan...I think a few things have been held until the start of the second half of the year for them," he said.
Dealers saw Kiwi trading a 0.6990-7010 range overnight.
